section.condition: TITLE=Trade Services: Export Letter Of Credit;PERM=el_access;ACCESS=EL_UX
section.para: An Export Letter of Credit (EL) or Documentary Credit is a banking mechanism that enables importers to offer secure terms to exporters. It is an undertaking given by a bank (the Issuing Bank) on behalf of the buyer (applicant) to pay a seller (beneficiary) a given amount of money on presentation of specified documents guaranteeing the supply of goods within specific time limits. These documents, conforming to terms and conditions set out in the letter of credit, are to be presented at a specified place. This EL is raised by a bank for approval by an applicant from a third party.

Whereas the Import Letter of Credit module provides an interface for the applicant to request a Letter of Credit, this module (EL) provides an interface for the beneficiary to receive and follow up a Letter of Credit.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company (which is the exporter and beneficiary), to receive notification of Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "EL", "Letter Of Credit", "Export EL", and "Export Letter of Credit" are used interchangeably.

section.title: Export Letter of Credit Landing Page
section.para: The Landing page displays a list of EL that are in various stages of an EL life cycle. The Landing page view is customizable based on your requirement.

note.para: You can customise the list of columns displayed through SDK.

section.para: The following image illustrates the Export Letter of Credit landing page:

note.para: Lists of columns displayed are customizable through SDK.

section.para:
The following ribbon items enable you perform various actions on individual ELs or in bulk, based on the tab you are on. Individual tabs and related functionality are described below:
Refer section Information on Action for details on actions available on each of the listed ribbon items.
Live
Lists all the approved Letter of Credit records and the expired Letter of Credit records by the bank.
Draft
Lists all ELs in draft state. You can Edit, View, Discard or view the history of events that Letter of Credit has gone through, through Details action.
Actions
Lists all the transactions on which the bank has requested client action.
Pending Approval
Lists all existing transactions that are awaiting client approval.
The Authorise action item is available only for a checker user.
A user with batch submission permission can select multiple transactions to Approve or Return though the checkbox provided for every transactions listed in this tab.
It is mandatory to provide the comments to return a transaction.
Pending at Bank
Lists all existing transactions that are awaiting bank approval.
Rejected
Lists all the rejected Letter of Credit records by the bank. The status given to such ELs is "Not Processed".
Closed
Lists all the transactions that have been marked as purged by the Remitting Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.

The Advance Filter presents you with various filter options like Event, Entity, Applicant, Currency and Expiry Date. Enter the relevant search criterion and apply the filter to list all the relevant ELs. You can also select the time frame for which data needs to be fetched.

You can perform the following actions on the listed ELs:
Search: Enter any of the Advance Filter search criterion in the search box to display the required list of LCs
CSV Download: Download the list of ELCs displayed on the dashboard. Click on the Download icon to list the formats in which the files can be downloaded. You can download Current Data or Full Data.
Current Data: Downloads the transactions displayed on screen.
Full Data: Downloads all the transactions available under a particular status tab like Draft, Rejected and more.
Column Filter: Add the column filter value to narrow down the search criterion for the listed LCs.

section.para:
This section describes the information presented on clicking any of the following actions against any given transaction:
Details
Return
Approve

entry.para: Field
Description

Displays the transaction details, all the events of transaction, attachments and charges associated with the transaction. The information is spread over three tabs 'Transaction Details', 'Events' and 'Additional Information'. Individual tabs are described below:
Click on Export LC Landing button at the top of Details page to navigate back to Export LC Landing page.
Click on Journey button at the top of Details page to view the history of events that the transaction has gone through.
Transaction Details: Displays the details of the transaction that is opened from the listing page. The tab lists the fields based on the action you click against the transaction.
Events: Displays the history of events that transaction has gone through. The transactions are either acknowledged by the bank or a reporting event is initiated by bank that requires an action to be performed by a corporate user.

If you are viewing the transaction details of an amended transaction, you can use the Compare button to see a comparative view of amended transaction (N) and transaction on which amendment was made (N-1).

section.title: Transfer
section.para: This section describes the Transfer action and the forms it uses.

This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of, from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Export Letters of Credit that have not been purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.

Amendment of an amended Export Letter of Credit transaction is property based. If the property trade.amend.restriction.enabled is set to 'true' then an EL transaction can be amended only once, then user must wait for bank's response to make another amendment on the transaction. If the property is set to 'False' then amendment over an already amended transaction is allowed.
This is applicable only to amendment transactions.

section.title: Licenses
section.para: Click on the Select License button and the List of licenses appears. Use Number and Currency fields to narrow down your search.

important.para: There are a few conditions that must be met for the licenses to be displayed in the popup. The following provides information for the conditions that could point to reasons that make licenses available or not available in the popup:

listitem.para: You should have created license(s) and linked it to the beneficiary selected in the Secondary Beneficiary Details section on this page. If you have selected a drawee for whom there are no licenses created, the popup will display a blank list. (This condition applies only if your administrator has selected Non-Principal Only in the License Definition. For any other selection, all licenses are available.)

Your selection of the transfer expiry date for the EL from the general details section should be within the valid to and from date of the license. Only licenses that match this criterion are displayed. If the transfer expiry date is beyond the license validity date, the list displays blank.

Your selection of multi-currency during license creation will allow you to select a currency in the Transfer Amount field that is different from the license currency and display the license in the popup. However, if multi-currency has not been selected, then the currency in the Transfer Amount field has to be the same as the license field for the license to be available in the popup.

section.para: Once you have selected a license, you have to enter a value in the Allocated Amount field that is equal to the transaction amount of the EL (refer to Amount Details section). If the amount available for the license is less than the transaction amount of the EL, you have to add and link one or more licenses to fill for the deficit.

If you have already linked a license, the details are displayed for System ID, Back Office Reference, License Number and Allocated Amount. You can choose to delete a linked license by clicking the Delete icon in the right-hand column.

section.title: Assignment
section.para: This section describes the Assignment action and the forms it uses.

This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of, from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Export Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.

Once complete, you can assign part of the proceeds that you expect to receive under an existing Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary. This can only be done for a Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Export Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable. The second beneficiary is only paid when your company, the main beneficiary, receives funds under the Letter of Credit. This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the assignment.

section.title: Generate Remittance Letter
section.para: This section describes the Generate Remittance Letter action and the forms it uses.

Select Generate Remittance Letter option to link a remittance letter against a standard Export Letter of Credit transaction. The remittance letter is generated in PDF format and is auto approved, once the terms of the contract have been met. Auto approval bypasses the confirmation from the Bank's side to approve the payment and is solely dependent on the customer.
